et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_animated et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_bg_layout_dark

div.h2: View our most recent communication below

div.div:
You may have heard Governor Gavin Newsom and State Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond address the public regarding the closure of California public schools. Governor Newsom asked all California schools to continue online and distance learning to mitigate the spread of COVID-19.
Given this state-wide direction, FUESD, along with school districts throughout San Diego County, is following this safety-first approach and will extend our school facility closures through the end of the school year. However, in the future, if the stay-at-home order is lifted and the COVID-19 situation improves, we will do our best to re-open school facilities.
To be clear, the 2019-20 school year is not over. While our schools may be physically closed, our district has been working diligently to provide students and families with the resources they need to learn and stay safe at home.

div.p: To lower the possible exposure of COVID-19 to our students, parents and staff, “Grab and Go” meals will be served on MONDAYS AND WEDNESDAYS from 11 am – 1 pm. Families will receive two or three days’ worth of meals at a time to ensure healthy, consistent meals for all children Monday through Friday. Meals are available to all children ages 2 through 18. No forms or registration is required. Families can visit one FUESD location per day to pick up meals.

p.strong: Locations for meal pick up starting Monday 3/23 are as follows:

ul.li: Maie Ellis Elementary | 400 W Elder St, Fallbrook, CA 92028 | 11 am – 1 pm
La Paloma Elementary | 300 Heald Ln, Fallbrook, CA 92028 | 11 am – 1 pm
Deluz School House | 40153 De Luz Murrieta RD., CA 92028 | 12-1 pm (1 hour only)
San Onofre School | 200 Pate Rd San Clemente, CA 92672 | 11 am – 1 pm
Mary Fay Pendleton | 110 Marine Dr Oceanside, CA 92058 | 11 am – 1 pm

hr.p: Para reducir la posible exposición de COVID-19 a nuestros estudiantes, padres y personal, las comidas “Agarra e Irte” se servirán los LUNES Y MIÉRCOLES de 11 am a 1 pm. Las familias recibirán dos o tres días de comidas a la vez para garantizar comidas saludables y consistentes para todos los niños de lunes a viernes. Las comidas están disponibles para todos los niños 2 – 18 años. No se requieren formularios ni registro. Las familias pueden visitar un lugar de FUESD por día para recoger comidas.

p.strong: Los lugares para recoger comida a partir del lunes 3/23 son los siguientes:

ul.li: Escuela Primaria Maie Ellis | 400 W Elder St, Fallbrook, CA 92028 | 11 am – 1 pm Escuela Primaria
La Paloma | 300 Heald Ln, Fallbrook, CA 92028 | 11 am – 1 pm
Escuela en Deluz | 40153 De Luz Murrieta RD., CA 92028 | 12-1 pm (una hora)
San Onofre School | 200 Pate Rd San Clemente, CA 92672 | 11 am – 1 pm
Mary Fay Pendleton | 110 Marine Dr Oceanside, CA 92058 | 11 am – 1 pm
